entries.description: The Unit type, and its sole inhabitant '', which is a value conveying no information.

entries.name: isA
entries.description: The subject is an instance of the class identified by the object.

entries.name: id
entries.description: The object is an unambiguous identifier of the subject within a given context.

entries.name: signed
entries.description: The object is a cryptographic signature of the subject.

entries.name: note
entries.description: The object is a human-readable note about the subject.

entries.name: hasRecipient
entries.description: The subject can be decrypted using the private key that decrypts the content key in the object.

entries.name: sskrShare
entries.description: The subject can be decrypted by a quorum of SSKR shares including the one in the object.

entries.name: controller
entries.description: The object is the subject's controlling entity.

entries.name: key
entries.description: The entity identified by the subject holds the private half of the public keys(s) in the object.

entries.name: dereferenceVia
entries.description: The content referenced by the subject can be dereferenced using the object.

entries.name: entity
entries.description: The entity referenced by the subject is specified in the object.

entries.name: name
entries.description: The subject is known by the name in the object.

entries.name: language
entries.description: The subject is written in the language of the ISO language code object.

entries.name: issuer
entries.description: The object is the subject's issuing entity.

entries.name: holder
entries.description: The object identifies the entity to which the subject has been issued.

entries.name: salt
entries.description: The object is random salt used to decorrelate the digest of the subject.

entries.name: date
entries.description: The object is a primary datestamp of the subject.

entries.name: Unknown
entries.description: Placeholder for an unknown value.

entries.name: version
entries.description: The object is the version of the subject.

entries.name: hasSecret
entries.description: The subject can be decrypted using the secret that decrypts the content key in the object.

entries.name: edits
entries.description: The object is a set of edits used by the Envelope.transform(edits:) method.

entries.name: validFrom
entries.description: The subject is valid from the date in the object.

entries.name: validUntil
entries.description: The subject is valid until the date in the object.

entries.name: position
entries.description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

entries.name: nickname
entries.description: The subject is a nickname for the object.

entries.name: attachment
entries.description: Declares that the object is a vendor-defined attachment to the envelope.

entries.name: vendor
entries.description: Declares the vendor of the subject.

entries.name: conformsTo
entries.description: An established standard to which the subject conforms.

entries.name: allow
entries.description: The object is a set of permissions that allow the subject to perform the actions specified in the object.

entries.name: deny
entries.description: The object is a set of permissions that deny the subject from performing the actions specified in the object.

entries.name: endpoint
entries.description: The object is a service endpoint associated with the subject.

entries.name: delegate
entries.description: The object is a delegate authorized by the subject.

entries.name: provenance
entries.description: The object is a provenance mark associated with the subject.

entries.name: privateKey
entries.description: The object is a private key associated with the subject.

entries.name: service
entries.description: The object is a service associated with the subject.

entries.name: capability
entries.description: The object is a capability associated with the subject.

entries.name: provenanceGenerator
entries.description: The object is a provenance mark generator associated with the subject.

entries.name: All
entries.description: The set of all allowed privileges.

entries.name: Authorize
entries.description: Operational privilege: authorize actions on behalf of the subject.

entries.name: Sign
entries.description: Operational privilege: sign documents on behalf of the subject.

entries.name: Encrypt
entries.description: Operational privilege: encrypt messages from the subject and decrypt messages to the subject.

entries.name: Elide
entries.description: Operational privilege: elide the subject's documents.

entries.name: Issue
entries.description: Operational privilege: issue documents on behalf of the subject.

entries.name: Access
entries.description: Operational privilege: access resources on behalf of the subject.

entries.name: Delegate
entries.description: Management privilege: delegate the privileges of the subject to another entity.

entries.name: Verify
entries.description: Management privilege: update the subject's documents, including the ability to reduce privileges.

entries.name: Update
entries.description: Management privilege: update the subject's service endpoints.

entries.name: Transfer
entries.description: Management privilege: remove the inception key from the XID document.

entries.name: Elect
entries.description: Management privilege: add or remove other verifiers (rotate keys).

entries.name: Burn
entries.description: Management privilege: transition to a new provenance mark chain.

entries.name: Revoke
entries.description: Management privilege: revoke the XID entirely.

entries.name: result
entries.description: The object is the success result of the request identified by the subject.

entries.name: error
entries.description: The object is the failure result of the request identified by the subject.

entries.name: OK
entries.description: The success result of a request that has no other return value.

entries.name: Processing
entries.description: The "in processing" result of a request.

entries.name: sender
entries.description: The object identifies the sender, including a way to verify messages from the sender (e.g. public key).

entries.name: senderContinuation
entries.description: The object is a continuation owned by the sender.

entries.name: recipientContinuation
entries.description: The object is a continuation owned by the recipient.

entries.name: content
entries.description: The object is the content of the event.

entries.name: Seed
entries.description: A cryptographic seed.

entries.name: PrivateKey
entries.description: A cryptographic private key.

entries.name: PublicKey
entries.description: A cryptographic public key.

entries.name: MasterKey
entries.description: A cryptographic master key.

entries.name: asset
entries.description: Declares a cryptocurrency asset specifier, e.g. "Bitcoin", "Ethereum"

entries.name: Bitcoin
entries.description: The Bitcoin cryptocurrency ("BTC")

entries.name: Ethereum
entries.description: The Ethereum cryptocurrency ("ETH")

entries.name: Tezos
entries.description: The Tezos cryptocurrency ("XTZ")

entries.name: network
entries.description: Declares a cryptocurrency network, e.g. "MainNet", "TestNet"

entries.name: MainNet
entries.description: A cryptocurrency main network

entries.name: TestNet
entries.description: A cryptocurrency test network

entries.name: BIP32Key
entries.description: A BIP-32 HD key

entries.name: chainCode
entries.description: Declares the chain code of a BIP-32 HD key

entries.name: DerivationPath
entries.description: A BIP-32 derivation path

entries.name: parentPath
entries.description: Declares the derivation path for a BIP-32 key

entries.name: childrenPath
entries.description: Declares the allowable derivation paths from a BIP-32 key

entries.name: parentFingerprint
entries.description: Declares the parent fingerprint of a BIP-32 key

entries.name: PSBT
entries.description: A Partially-Signed Bitcoin Transaction (PSBT)

entries.name: OutputDescriptor
entries.description: A Bitcoin output descriptor

entries.name: outputDescriptor
entries.description: Declares a Bitcoin output descriptor associated with the subject

entries.name: Graph
entries.description: A graph. All other assertions in the envelope must be either node or edge.

entries.name: SourceTargetGraph
entries.description: A graph with edges that have source and target assertions.

entries.name: ParentChildGraph
entries.description: A graph with edges that have parent and child assertions.

entries.name: Digraph
entries.description: A directed graph. Implies SourceTargetGraph. source and target are distinct.

entries.name: AcyclicGraph
entries.description: A graph that does not admit cycles. Implies SourceTargetGraph.

entries.name: Multigraph
entries.description: A multigraph (admits parallel edges). Implies SourceTargetGraph.

entries.name: Pseudograph
entries.description: A pseudograph (admits self-loops and parallel edges). Implies Multigraph.

entries.name: GraphFragment
entries.description: A fragment of a graph. May have references to external nodes and edges that are not resolvable in the fragment.

entries.name: DAG
entries.description: A directed acyclic graph. Implies Digraph and AcyclicGraph.

entries.name: Tree
entries.description: A tree. Implies ParentChildGraph. Exactly one node must have no parent. All other nodes must have exactly one parent.

entries.name: Forest
entries.description: A forest (set of trees). Implies ParentChildGraph.

entries.name: CompoundGraph
entries.description: A compound graph (a graph with subgraphs). Implies Forest and SourceTargetGraph.

entries.name: Hypergraph
entries.description: An undirected hypergraph (edges may connect more than two nodes).

entries.name: Dihypergraph
entries.description: A directed hypergraph (edges may connect more than two nodes and have a direction). Implies Hypergraph and Digraph.

entries.name: node
entries.description: A node in a graph.

entries.name: edge
entries.description: An edge in a graph.

entries.name: source
entries.description: Identifies the source node of the subject edge of a SourceTargetGraph.

entries.name: target
entries.description: Identifies the target node of the subject edge of a SourceTargetGraph.

entries.name: parent
entries.description: Identifies the parent node of the subject edge of a ParentChildGraph.

entries.name: child
entries.description: Identifies a child node of the subject edge of a ParentChildGraph.

entries.name: Self
entries.description: A reference to the subject itself.
